borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The&nbsp;proposed front extension by reason of scale and sitting, results in a discordant feature which disrupts the uniform and aligned frontages along the wider street scene of Ford Road. Therefore, the proposed front extension is</span>&nbsp;considered harmful to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area, notably given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies&nbsp;SP 2, &nbsp;DMD 1, DMD 4&nbsp;and DMD 6 of the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020);</span></div><div>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</div>

<div><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed front dormer by reason of presenting a highly prominent and disruptive feature within the street scene is</span>&nbsp;considered harmful to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area, notably given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate.&nbsp; As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies&nbsp;SP 2, &nbsp;DMD 1, DMD 4&nbsp;and DMD 6 of the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020);</span></div><div>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</div>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">The proposed relocation of parking by reason of&nbsp;moving&nbsp;the existing on-street car parking space,&nbsp;a Controlled Parking Zone space, fails to meet the councils dropped kerb guidance which states that moving a Controlled Parking Zone parking bay is not allowed.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</p><p><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policy 6.13 of the London Plan&nbsp;</span>(March 2016);</p><p><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policy T6 of the Draft London Plan&nbsp;</span>Intended to Publish (December 2019);</p><p><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policy DMT 2 of the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020);</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policy BR9 of the L</span>DF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011).<br></p>
description: Construction of a front dormer extension to facilitate conversion of roof space into habitable accommodation (retrospective) and Construction of a single storey front extension and relocation of parking to front and side driveway.
